page.title: 02LYDFORD
page.content:
Lydford is a small village lying on the Western edge of Dartmoor.It was built at the site of a ford across the River Lyd and commanded the route between Tavistock,10 miles to the South and Okehampton,10 miles to the North East.
The National Trust owns Lydford Gorge, which is a beauty spot that attracts many visitors during the Summer months. The ruined Castle is also of interest and is maintained by the Department of the Environment.
Lydford possesses a Post Office, a Primary School and two shops but the Railway Station has been axed and the Bus Service is limited.1
